Title: Election results 2019: The key points you need
Article: Polls have closed in the UK general election and votes are being counted.Here are the most important points you need to know as the results come in through the night.Follow the latest news at it happens on our live page.No party won a majority in Parliament in 2017, after Theresa May's Conservatives lost seats in England and Wales to Labour and the Liberal Democrats.Use the search box below to find your constituency and the candidates who stood. These pages will be updated once the results are in.For a nationwide breakdown of results, see our results page, which will be updated throughout the night.If you can't see the look-up click here.Or you can browse the A-Z list.A total of 3,322 candidates are standing for election in the UK's 650 parliamentary seats.
